Description: Eleven fragments of a silver diadem or attachment; made from sheet metal decorated with repoussé rosettes.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: For more recently discovered examples from Amathus, see Laffineur 1992, 23-4 and pls. VII-VII. Bibliography: Laffineur R. 1992, La nécropole d'Amathonte. Tomb 113-367. VI. Bijoux, armes, verre, astragales et coquillages, squelettes (Nicosia)
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.118, Tomb 48)
Laffineur et al. 1986 / Amathonte III. Testimonia 3. L'Orfèvrerie. Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes. La coupe en argent du British Museum (No. 67, p.24)
